name: Git Time Metric
tagline: Simple, seamless, lightweight time tracking for Git
body: ### **Simple** Install the GTM executable and a plugin for your favorite editor. To enable time tracking for a Git project simply run `gtm init` within the project's root directory. ### **Seamless** No need to remember to stop and start timers. GTM knowns when you are working and does it for you. ### **Lightweight** You will not experience any lag or overhead. The GTM process only runs intermittently to capture the time spent. ## Gain insights in where time is invested **Git commits with time spent** ``` > gtm report -n 3 9361c18 Rename packages Sun Jun 19 09:56:40 341bd77 Vagrant file for testing on Linux Sun Jun 19 09:43:47 2016 -0500 Michael Schenk 1h 16m 0s 792ba19 Require a 40 char SHA commit hash Thu Jun 16 22:28:45 2016 -0500 Michael Schenk 1h 1m 0s ``` **Git commits with detailed time spent by file** ``` > gtm report -format files b2d16c8 Refactor discovering of paths when recording events Thu Jun 16 11:08:47 2016 -0500 Michael Schenk 30m 18s [m] event/event.go 12m 31s [m] event/manager.go 3m 14s [m] project/project.go 1m 12s [r] .git/COMMIT_EDITMSG 1m 0s [r] .git/index 25s [r] event/manager_test.go 20s [r] metric/manager.go 49m 0s ``` **Timeline of time spent by day** ``` > gtm report -format timeline 0123456789012345678901234 Fri Jun 24 * 22m 0s Sat Jun 25 ** 1h 28m 0s Sun Jun 26 **** 3h 28m 0s Mon Jun 27 * 4m 0s Tue Jun 28 ** 1h 36m 0s 6h 58m 0s ``` ## Available Editor Plugins ***Stay tuned, more are on the way*** ## Getting Started Consult the [README](https://github.com/git-time-metric/gtm/blob/master/README.md) and [Wiki](https://github.com/git-time-metric/gtm/wiki) for more information.
